result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin Carl Badboy was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 merged and dismissed.
Probation may be transferred to Juno County.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott J. Nordstrand amend credit.

-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and CVTC in Chippewa Falls WI.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Court converts costs into a civil judgment and all money earned in prison to be applied to those costs.

ADA Mckinley gives recommendation and argument.  Attorney Caton gives recommendation and argument.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders: 

Ct. 1 on 14CF210
- DE sentenced to 3 years I/C and 2 years E/S
- 265 days credit for time served
- AODA with follow through with any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE is eligible for substance abuse program and CVTC in Chippewa Falls WI
- 27 months drivers license revocation
- 27 months IID  
- Court costs of $1,678.38 to be a civil judgment and all money earned in prison to be applied to the restitution
- DE to be remanded to the St. Croix County Jail for transportation to Dodge
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF: Kevin Carl Badboy appeared.  Court called at 4:18 p.m. Includes case 14CF210 (Plea/Sentencing), 14TR2395 & 14TR2396 (Payment hearings).  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 in the amended information in 14CF210.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF210. On motion of the State, Crt merges in and dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF210. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

- W/S for 3 years probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 150 days in the St. Croix County Jail 
- 56 days credit for time served
- DE can serve sentence in Juno County at no cost to St. Croix County and will be set up through DE's attorney
- Probation can be transfered to Juno County.
- AODA with follow through with any recommended treatment
- 27 months drivers license revocation
- 27 months IID  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $1,424 and $250 for DNA Surcharge and $52.00 for blood draw to be paid through the DOC  
- 14TR2395 &14TR2396 to be paid through the DOC 
- 20 days to appeal
Plea hearing on June 30, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
